H0.text: Camouflage is the adaptation that helps prey hide and predators sneak up on prey.

H1.text: Scent is an adaptation that helps prey hide and predators sneak up on prey.

H2.text: Claws are an adaptation that helps prey hide and predators sneak up on prey.

H3.text: Variation is an adaptation that helps prey hide and predators sneak up on prey.

A4.text: As a strategy, crypsis is used by predators against prey and by prey against predators.

A5.text: Some animals, in both terrestrial and aquatic environments, appear to camouflage their odor, which might otherwise attract predators.

A7.text: camouflage to avoid detection is destroyed when vivid coloration is displayed at mating time.

A8.text: Mimicry is thus an anti-predator adaptation.
